result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Strotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING DECEMBER 7, 2015 AT 8:30 P.M. BR. 15

miscConds.notes:
$10.00 to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
The Court will allow 60 days for documentation to be submitted as to additional restitution.
**$568.09 to victim.  Joint and several with Marquille Latson

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.

No contact with victim, AM, or family.
No internet access for social media purposes.

Sex offender assessment and treatment.
Cognitive training needs to be determined.
Register as a sex offender for 15 years.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 38.
Defendant Jermaine Strotter in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Jermaine Strotter in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 15 days of the condition time with 13 days credit for time served. Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 38 is not available this morning.  Case to be heard by Branch 25, Judge Rothstein.

records.addlTxt:
Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Jacqueline S.; Jerome K.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 251 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 6-4-2015 at 8:15 in Branch 38.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-Cognitive training needs to be determined.
-Register as a sex offender for 15 years.
-Perform 30 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-No contact with victim, AM, or family.
-No internet access for social media purposes.
-$10.00 to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
The court will allow 60 days for documentation to be submitted as to additional restitution.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Filed: notice of right to seek postconviction relief; ineligible voting acknowledgement; pretrial credit

Defendant Jermaine Strotter in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Jermaine Strotter in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended information filed 10-28-2014 is reinstated charging one count of THIRD DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, a class G felony pursuant to 940.225(3).
To the amended information:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed on 11-17-2014 is accepted on today's date.  Statement to the court by defense as to factual basis.   Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Defendant Jermaine Strotter in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Jermaine Strotter in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to his plea.  Court unable to accept plea.  Court vacates today's attempt to take a plea to the amended charges.  Court vacates the amended information.  Case adjourned for Sentencing for the original charge.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

filed.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Jermaine Strotter not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Jermaine Strotter not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in trial.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court advised of any deportation possibilities.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Strotter in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Jermaine Strotter in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
